lines.text: Why'd you drive her car into the bay?
Couldn't find a car wash.

[after the game]
Fuck you, boy!
Not today, boss!
[Caretaker and Crewe are watching a prisoner go through his workout]
Well, there he is. Connie Shokner, baddest cat in the joint. Even the guards are scared of him. He killed three people on the outside and two since he's been in here.
Yeah, that karate's some bad stuff.
Oh, that was before he learned karate.
Say, what's he doing now?
Nobody's ever had the guts to ask him.
I think I broke his fuckin' neck!
I think he broke his fuckin' neck!
One side, one side.
[Examines injured player]
Get the ambulance! I think he broke his fuckin' neck.
See! I told you I broke his fuckin' neck!
Whattya got for me, Sunshine?
I can get you steroids, vitamins, greenies, anything you want. You name it. I'm the best hustler in the joint.
How much of what this guy says he can do, can he do?
He can get you laid in here... with a woman.

Alright men, now here's the play we're gonna use. I don't think the guards know this formation. It's called 'incidental punishment after the ball is blown dead.' Remember, any man you tackle gets an elbow, knee, or kick in the mouth.
How do ya like them apples, Superstar?
You take your football down here real serious, don't you?
You mind if I ask you one question?
Yes, I do mind!
Why did you do it?
It's a long story.
Well, I got eight years.
Hey Pop, the time you hit Hazen in the mouth, was it worth 30 years?
For me it was.
Then give me my damn shoe!
My, you have lovely hair. You ever find any spiders in it?
What's his name?
Indian.
That makes sense.
Now don't go making any ethnic jokes.
[They meet the Indian]
Paul Crewe. Heard you played some football.
Yeah.
Where?
Oklahoma State.
Oklahoma State U?
Prison.
Well, first thing we have to do is get you out of here.
How?
[Paul looks back at Caretaker]
Well, we'll work on it.
[last lines]

[to the warden]
Stick this in your trophy case.
[he walks into the stadium tunnel]
I knew you could do it!

[looking at a shirtless Shokner doing some unusual physical moves]
What's he doin' now?
Nobody's ever had the guts to ask him.
Nate, if you're thinking about winning this game, then you're as crazy as he is.

Well, maybe so. But you spend fourteen years in this tank, you begin to understand that you've only got two thing left they can't sweat out of you or beat out of you. Your balls. And you better hang onto them, because they're about the only thing you're gonna have when you get out of here.
What the hell was that?
That was a dropkick.
Dropkick?
Dropkick.
How much is that worth?
Three points.
Three points?
Three points.
For that? Bullshit!
Dammit, Warden, I think this game's a big mistake.

Captain, not only will you have the chance to hone our team to a fine edge, you'll also have the opportunity to learn a great deal about life. Why is it, do you suppose, that I can walk through this yard, surrounded by hate, and in total command?
Because you've got 15 gun turrets all around you that say you can.

[after Black Inmates join team]
Well Mr. Crewe, Were in business, Compliments from the greater Chicago Youth Authority.
There goes the neighborhood!
[All the inmates laugh]
Most of these old boys don't have nothing. Never had nothing to start with. But you, You had it all. Then you let your teammates down, got yourself caught with your hand in the cookie jar.
Oh I did, did I?

Oh I ain't saying you did or you didn't. All I'm saying is that you could have robbed banks, sold dope or stole your grandmother's pension checks and none of us would have minded. But shaving points off of a football game, man that's un-American.
to protect your quarterback - ME!
You know, there's only one thing I'm sorry about.
What's that, Mr. Crewe?
That you're not out here with us knockin' heads.
I'm afraid I'm a little old for that.
No, you never had the guts to begin with!

[Drunkenly as a short policeman comes to arrest him]
Look what we have here - a miniature cop!
Now to me, that's biscuits and gravy.
How do you think we'd do against the pros?
That team against the pros?
Yeah.
Well, you'd have a real problem.
Well, how do you think we'd do against the cons?
We're gettin' up a football game against the guards. Wondered if maybe you and some of your buddies here would like to join in on the fun.
With the guards?
Uh huh.
Sure, I'd like that.
You know what my problem has been all my life? I've always had my shit together. Always. My problem's been I couldn't lift it.
Hissss-toe-ree.
I'll see ya on the field, Superstar.
[first lines]
How long do we have to keep watching this crap?... Only a moron can sit and watch two football games, one after the other.
For Nate, for Granny... for Caretaker.
[the Black Inmates are gathered together talking about the football tryouts]

[about Crewe]
This Honky golden boy sold out his teammates, didn't he!
He sure as hell did!
He did it once, he'll do it again!

[All the Black Inmates Respond in unison with Black Power Fist]
RIGHT ON!
Mr. Crewe, as old Mr. Sam used to say, 'In this institution, to get along, you go along.'
You know something, Crewe? I don't like you. You understand that?
Oh yeah.

[giving the rifle to Hazen]
Game ball!
